RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BAYLIS STREET engaged in close chase through the backstretch and raced off the rail on the turn, dug in leaving the eighth pole and got up the final strides. DEVIN ON EARTH took a quick lead and rated the early pace inside, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole, contested the advantage at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady handling through the stretch but was caught in the final strides. GREAT DEVOTION chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail then eased outward through the upper stretch and finished evenly. CURLIN'S DOVE gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and showed little further. FESSIN UP chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and showed little in the stretch. DATS A SUPERSTAR saved ground while giving chase.

ENTRY.NAME: Baylis Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,close off rail turn,dug in lane,up final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligib ility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SISTER JOANN pressured the pace and raced at even terms nearest the rail on the turn, took the nod passing the eighth pole, dueled clear mid-stretch and held on under steady encouragement. I'M A TOTAL DIVA set a pressured pace and contested even terms two deep on the turn, was met passing the eighth pole but finished evenly at the outside flank of the winner. RISKSRHIGHPAYISLOW chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail, eased out entering the stretch and ran evenly in the stretch. ULTRA DIVA chased the leaders, rounded the turn off the rail, eased out leaving the turn and flattened in the lane. MOIRAINE steadied from tight quarters between horses nearing the seven sixteenths pole but quickly recovered stride, rounded the turn in the four and five paths, left the turn outside and finished well. C TWO gave chase toward the outside, rounded the turn about the four path and weakened in the lane. MOJO MATTERS was shuffled back early then gave chase outside and raced in the five path on the turn. The Stewards reviewed, then rejected a claim of foul against the riders of both Dats A Superstar and Curlin's Dove for alleged interference approaching the seven sixteenths pole, lodged by the rider of Baylis Street.

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Joann
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,even terms rail turn,nod past 1/8,clear 1/16,driving

ENTRY.NAME: Moiraine
ENTRY.COMMENT: in tight early,chased,4& 5p turn,finished well outside

ENTRY.NAME: I'm a Total Diva
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,even terms 2d turn,met past 1/8,even finish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 T o $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMOKIN LADY took the lead soon after the start and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was pressured nearing the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and held well under steady stretch handling. STRONG WILLED stalked off the rail, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and dueled through the stretch for second. LOVE OF GRACE settled in the three path the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, then relented in the stretch duel for second. APPEALING ROAD raced off the rail the opening turn then eased out into the backstretch, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path then flattened the final sixteenth. HOW IS SHE steadied leaving the gate then saved ground, bid mildly past the three eighths pole and raced in the four path on the far turn. JACKYSINTHECASTLE rated close to the early pace inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. EX RATED saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Jackysinthecastle
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: How Is She
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied break,saved ground,mild bid 3/8,4p far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Willed
ENTRY.OWNER: Nikki Horses Racing and Fanelli John

ENTRY.NAME: Smokin Lady
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 5/16,rail far turn,held well driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 51. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allow ed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LET'S DO THIS had a brief early lead then gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn then dueled through the stretch and inched ahead later yards. JUJU ON DA BEAT chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. POWER SONDE gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn, left the turn outside and finished well while gaining on the top two. IT'S A REAL HONOR dueled for the lead past the seven sixteenths pole and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn, was met mid-stretch and flattened stride. LIL BUNNY pressured the pace past the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back nearing the quarter pole, race at the rail on the turn and flattened in the lane. WARRIORINTHEHOUSE saved ground while giving chase.

ENTRY.NAME: Let's Do This
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief lead,chased,3p turn,dueled stretch,inched ahead later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eli gibility)(Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIVER REWARDS RVF gave chase and raced close off the rail on the turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and drew away later yards. WITNESS THE ENERGY raced clear while angling to the inside and rated the early pace, was pressured past the three eighths pole, rounded the turn at the rail but gave up the lead mid-stretch and flattened later yards. SKYLAR'S SISTER chased, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. DAPHNE'S FIRE gave chase then flattened in the three path on the turn. EMBERLY saved ground while giving chase.

ENTRY.NAME: River Rewards Rvf
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,close off rail turn,up 1/16,drew away later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COMIDA COMIDA set a pressured early pace, was met and dueled at even terms from the three eighths pole, recovered the advantage two deep approaching the quarter pole and was steadily handled in the stretch. LIKELY CHOICE angled in leaving the chute and gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and dug in to clear second later yards. SURCHARGE gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and came along for third later yards. WATCH ME DISAPPEAR was shut off leaving the chute then gave chase, rounded the turn about the four path then flattened stride. ZUPITA pressured the pace and dueled at even terms from the three eighths pole, was met at the rail approaching the quarter, dropped back midway on the turn and weakened in the lane. RED PRIESTESS was steadied leaving the chute, gave chase through the backstretch and raced in the five path on the turn. The Stewards reviewed a claim of foul against the rider of Likely Choice for interference leaving the chute, lodged by the rider of Watch Me Disappear and as a result, disqualified the former to fourth place.

ENTRY.NAME: Surcharge
ENTRY.OWNER: CM Racing and Jones Jr Michael E

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Wasabi Ventures Stables LLC & Greenspring Mares LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Watch Me Disappear
ENTRY.COMMENT: shut off leaving chute,chased,4p turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Likely Choice
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in past chute,chased,off rail turn,cleared 2nd later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 26 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 26 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SIDESWIPED settled back in the four path the opening turn then moved to the inside entering the backstretch, started a bid toward the five sixteenths pole, angled widest through the far turn then dug in under steady handling to take over later yards, and drew off approaching the wire. LACE REVOLUTION saved ground on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, dueled to a slim lead past the eighth pole but was caught in late yards. GOLDEN BELL rated close to the early pace inside, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and came along to take third the final yards. BABA took the lead while tapering in and set the early pace, was met at the nine sixteenths pole and dueled at even terms from that point, recovered the nod toward the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn but was caught leaving the eighth pole and weakened. SHERIFF'S KID was not a factor. COMPLETE SURPRISE raced two deep the first turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. ROCK ROSE closed to even terms two deep into the first turn and contested the edge to the three eighths pole, but dropped back toward the five sixteenths, raced in the three path on the far turn and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Rock Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: even terms 5/8,dueled to 3/8,dropped back,3p turn,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Lace Revolution
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 7/16,off rail far turn,led past 1/8,caught late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allow ed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SNEAKY LYNK rated close inside on the first turn, raced hemmed in through the backstretch but angled out with a three wide bid past the quarter pole, dueled to the lead toward mid-stretch and drew off the final sixteenth. ODINA rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole and took the lead two deep past the quarter but was met while flattening stride nearing mid-stretch. I SHALLBE RELEASED came away awkwardly then saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the quarter pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and dueled for third inside the sixteenth pole. PETTYFORURTHOUGHTS rated close inside, challenged two deep leaving the three eighths pole and had a slim lead toward the five sixteenths, but was caught at the rail midway on the far turn and weakened approaching mid-stretch. PRINCESS HALO raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and weakened. LAURA'S GRAND raced two deep on the first turn then faded through the backstretch. IMINCHARGENOW took the lead nearing the three quarter pole and moved to the inside into the first turn, came under pressure toward the three eighths, was met toward the five sixteenths and faded at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Sneaky Lynk
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,hem in backstretch,3wd bid past 1/4,up1/16,drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Iminchargenow
ENTRY.OWNER: Ali Andrew and Schottroffe Edward T
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated early pace,pressured 3/8,met 5/16,faded rail far turn
